intro: Sophronia, commonly known as the "butterfly flower," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Gentianaceae. These plants are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in the southern United States and parts of Mexico. Sophronia species are characterized by their showy, often brightly colored flowers that resemble butterflies, hence their common name. The flowers typically have five petals, which are often bilaterally symmetrical. These plants are often found in woodland or shaded areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
